quotes.quote: I'm so shy now I wear sunglasses everywhere I go.
Nothing is as irritating to a shy man as a confident girl.
There is a certain delightful sort of hope which the introvert can receive only by having company over...the hope that they will leave soon.
I have reason to be shy. I've been hurt plenty.
A shy failure is nobler than an immodest success.
I've gotten better at not making people feel uncomfortable with my shyness.
The shell must break before the bird can fly.
Humility is so shy. If you begin talking about it, it leaves.
Shyness has a strange element of narcissism, a belief that how we look, how we perform, is truly important to other people.
When a shy person smiles, it's like the sun coming out.
My feelings are too loud for words and too shy for the world.
There is nothing that makes us feel more lonely than our shyness.
The introvert's anthem for not wanting to hang out is 'It's not you; it's me.
The shy man does have some slight revenge upon society for the torture it inflicts upon him.
Timidity is the silent acceptance of bondage.

Everyone is shy it is the inborn modesty that makes us able to live in harmony with other creatures and our fellows. Achievement comes not by denying shyness but, occasionally, by setting it aside and letting pride and perspiration come first.
Social taboos are shy like virtue; once lost, there is no remedy.
It is only through timidity that states are lost.
One is always half mad when one is shy of people.
Shyness is just egotism out of its depth.
A shy face is better than a forward heart.
There is safety in reserve, but no attraction. One cannot love a reserved person.
The way you overcome shyness is to become so wrapped up in something that you forget to be afraid.
Maybe shy is when you're lonely and you don't think anybody can help you.
I live in a shell, so I can't blame people when they don't want to crack me. But people like you are the reason I left the nest.
I felt suddenly shy. I was not used to shy. I was used to shame. Shyness is when you turn your head away from something you want. Shame is when you turn your head away from something you do not want.

Just because you don't say much doesn't mean people don't notice you. It's actually the quiet ones who often draw the most attention. There's this constant whirlwind of motion and sound all around, and then there's the quiet one, the eye of the storm.
Introductions are hard to come by when your natural state is shyness.
The flower that smells the sweetest is shy and lowly.
One must not be shy where language is concerned.
